snippet: Speculation intensified over the whereabouts of Xi Jinping, China’s presumptive new president, who has been missing from public view in recent days.
abstract: Xi Jinping, China's presumptive new leader, has seemingly disappeared from public view, setting off furious speculation that his health, either physical or political, has taken a turn for the worse; Xi's unexplained absence over the past week is conspicuous on the eve of what is supposed to be China's once-in-a-decade transfer of power, and adds to a litany of woes that have disrupted the Communist Party’s hopes for a seamless political transition.

byline.contributor: Patrick Zuo contributed research from Beijing. Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Speculation intensified over the whereabouts of Xi Jinping, China’s presumptive new president, who has been missing from public view in recent days.

headline.seo: Xi Jinping’s Absence Stokes Rumor Mills in China
headline.main: Communist Leader’s Absence Sets Off Rumor Mills in China
headline.print_headline: Communist Leader’s Absence Sets Off Rumor Mills in China
